paper_type.justification: The paper's primary purpose is to describe and evaluate a methodology (FAIMS mobile platform deployment) rather than to present new empirical findings about the archaeological sites themselves. It uses case studies instrumentally to illustrate software co-development processes, not as primary research outcomes.

expressed_approach.justification: The paper does not explicitly state a research methodology or epistemological stance. It presents itself as a reflective account of deployment experiences without framing within established research paradigms.

indicators: Three themes emerge from the descriptions of the case studies
Experience from these deployments informed ongoing development
The authors of this paper believe that FAIMS strikes a good balance
revealed_approach.justification: The paper works inductively from specific deployment experiences to general claims about software co-development. Themes are derived from case observations rather than tested against pre-specified hypotheses. Conclusions generalise from particular cases to broader claims about generalised vs bespoke software approaches.

approach_comparison.notes: No expressed methodology to compare against revealed approach. Paper is consistently inductive throughout without claiming otherwise.

qualitative_components: Case study narratives from project directors
quantitative_components: Performance measurements (upload speeds, WiFi signal strength)
mixed_methods.integration_approach: Quantitative metrics embedded within qualitative case narratives to support thematic claims
